( NewsCore)- Defense spending should not be spared the knife when it comes to tackling the budget deficit, former Secretary of State Colin Powell said Sunday. The retired general, speaking on CNN's State of the Union, said he sees no reason why the military should not be considered for spending cuts as lawmakers grapple with the ballooning deficit. Colin Powell pointed out that defense spending had at one time been cut 25 percent.
